intro: Gymnolomia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate gymnolomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers with six tepals, which bloom in early spring. Gymnolomia auriculata is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
